comment: Name: Response from Dynamic DNS server
Sample: "Response from server: update succeeded with no change, abusive warning (1)"
Description: Receive the specified response from the dynamic DNS server.
Name: Dynamic DNS Domain Name Resolved
Sample: Dynamic DNS server domain name successfully resolved to an IP address.
Description: Connected to the specified dynamic DNS server.
Description: Connecting to the specified dynamic DNS server.
Sample: Activate dynamic DNS on the specified interface.
Description: Activating DynDNS on interface: External
Format: Activating Dynamic DNS on interface: %s
Name: Received reply from the server
Sample: "Received reply: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Date: Tue, 27 Nov 2012 17:14:57 GMT Server: Apache Content-Type: text/plain Connection: close good 192.168.53.88"
Description: Received the specified reply from the dynamic DNS server.
Format: %s: Buffer Overflow. buf start[%p], buf end[%p], current pointer[%p]
Name: Unable to resolve domain name
Sample: Could not resolve domain for dynamic DNS server.
Description: Could not resolve server: members.dyndns.org
Name: Failed to connect to the server
Sample: "Could not connect to members.dyndns.org / 204.13.248.111, connection refused"
Description: Could not connect to the dynamic DNS server due to specified reason.
Name: Unable to connect to server
Sample: Unable to connect to server: members.dyndns.org / 204.13.248.111
Description: Unable to connect to the specified dynamic DNS server.
Format: Unable to connect to server: %s / %s
Variables: Unable to connect to server: ${server_name} / ${server_ip}
Sample: No response from server members.dyndns.org / 204.13.248.111
Description: Not able to get response from specified dynamic DNS server.
Sample: The dynamic DNS server returned an invalid response code. The log message specifies that code.
Name: The time for next update
Sample: The log message specifies the next update time for dynamic DNS.
Description: "Next update is on Tue, 27 Nov 2012 17:14:57"
Sample: Sending dynamic DNS update request. The log message specifies the size and content of the request.
Description: Sending update request (138 bytes): GET /nic/update?system=dyndns
Sample: Updated an IPv4 dynamic route. The log message specifies the route that is changed.
Description: Sync add an IPv4 dynamic route (10.0.1.2/24 gw 10.0.1.254 ifindex 1 metric 10)
Format: %s %s an IPv4 dynamic route (%s/%d gw %s ifindex %d metric %d)
Variables: ${event} ${action} an IPv4 dynamic route (${ip}/${mask} gw ${gw} ifindex ${ifindex} metric ${metric}
Sample: Failed to retrieve license features for dynamic routing.
Description: Failed to retrieve active license features
Format: Failed to retrieve active license features
Sample: Failed to parse license features for dynamic routing.
Description: Failed to parse the active license features
Format: Failed to parse the active license features
Name: Not able to get license
Sample: Not able to get license for dynamic routing features.
Description: Could not get license for dynamic routing features
Format: Could not get license for dynamic routing features
Sample: Received an interface status event.
Sample: Received cluster role change event.
Description: Received cluster role change event
Format: Received cluster role change event
Sample: Received a license update event.
Sample: "RCS(10.10.10.10) is unresponsive, and is considered stopped"
Description: The RCS at the specified IP address has become unresponsive
Format: RCS(%s) is unresponsive, and is considered stopped
Variables: "RCS(${ip}) is unresponsive, and is considered stopped"
Name: Not able to forward request to RCS
Sample: Not able to forward request to RCS due to no connection.
Description: "Could not forward request to RCS, not connected"
Format: Could not forward request to RCS, not connected
Name: An error was detected in the configuration. The log message specifies the line number of the error.
Sample: An error was detected in the configuration. The log message specifies the line number of the error.
Description: "Configuration error detected in ripd.conf, line 12: 'network 192.168.53.0/24 area 0'"
Format: Configuration error detected in %s, line %d: '%s'
Name: Not able to connect to RCS
Sample: Not able to connect to RCS with the specified IP address.
Format: Could not connect to RCS, %s
Sample: Connection to RCS was closed
Format: Connection to RCS was closed
Sample: System loaded Modem process, but another instance is already active.
Description: Another instance of Modem is running
Format: Another instance of Modem is running
Sample: Initiate gratuitous ARP for the specified interface.
Sample: Initiate gratuitous ARP for all the interfaces.
Description: Initiating GARP for all interfaces
Format: Initiating GARP for all interfaces
Name: Send interface logical link status event
Sample: "[eth0] Sending interface status event, logical=up link=up ip=10.0.0.1 mask=255.255.255.0"
Description: Interface status event is sent for logical link status change.
Format: [%s] Sending interface status event%s, logical=%s link=%s ip=%u.%u.%u.%u mask=%u.%u.%u.%u
Variables: "[${dev_name}] Sending interface status event, logical=${logical} link=${link} ip=${ip} mask=${mask}"
Name: Send interface link status event
Sample: [eth0] Sending interface status event for link up
Description: Interface status event is sent for link change.
Format: [%s] Sending interface status event%s for link %s
Variables: [${dev_name}] Sending interface status event for link ${link}
Name: A change was made to the IP address of the external interface
Sample: Handle IP address for the specified external interface.
Description: [eth0 (External)] External Interface set IP address
Sample: Ignore unknown address operation on the specified interface.
Description: [eth0 (External)] Ignoring unknown address operation sss
Name: Layer 2 traffic gate is closed
Sample: [Cluster] The traffic gate of layer2 is closed due to cluster role backup
Description: Layer 2 traffic gate is closed due to the specified reason.
Format: [Cluster] The traffic gate of layer2 is closed due to cluster role %s
Variables: [Cluster] The traffic gate of layer2 is closed due to cluster role ${role}
Name: Layer 2 traffic gate is opened
Sample: [Cluster] The traffic gate of layer2 is opened due to cluster role master
Description: Layer 2 traffic gate is opened due to the specified reason.
Format: [Cluster] The traffic gate of layer2 is opened due to cluster role %s
Variables: [Cluster] The traffic gate of layer2 is opened due to cluster role ${role}
Sample: Traffic signal is changed to the specified status.
Sample: Stopping the specified wireless Access Point.
Sample: Started to process configuration settings.
Description: Starts processing a configuration setting
Format: Starts processing a configuration setting
Sample: Updating global bridge mode setting
Description: Update global bridge mode settings.
Format: Updating global bridge mode setting
Sample: Updating global drop-in mode setting
Description: Update global drop-in mode settings.
Format: Updating global drop-in mode setting
Sample: Cluster] Clean up stale IP connections with expired address 192.168.1.22 for PPPoE interface eth0
Description: Clean up stale connections for the expired IP address on dynamic interface.
Format: [Cluster] Clean up stale IP connections with expired address %s for %s interface %s
Variables: [Cluster] Clean up stale IP connections with expired address ${ip} for dynamic interface ${dev_name}

Sample: "DNSWatch is expired or was disabled. Your Firebox does not have a configured DNS server. To make sure your Firebox does not use the DNSWatch servers, you must specify a DNS server in the network DNS/WINS settings."

Format: DNSWatch is expired or was disabled. Your Firebox does not have a configured DNS server. To make sure your Firebox does not use the DNSWatch servers, you must specify a DNS server in the network DNS/WINS settings.
Sample: Capture stopped due to the specified reason.
Sample: Add bridge interface in bridge mode.
Sample: [Cluster] Update arp rules for cluster role backup
Description: Update ARP rules for the specified cluster role.
Format: [Cluster] Update arp rules for cluster role %s
Variables: [Cluster] Update arp rules for cluster role ${role}
Sample: Fix up multipath gateways of the specified number successfully.
Sample: Update secondary IP address settings for the specified interface.
Description: Updating Trust-1 secondary IP(s) setting
Sample: Another instance of the PPPoE process is already active in the system.
Description: Another instance of PPPoE is running
Format: Another instance of PPPoE is running
Name: Invalid PPPoE automatic restart settings
Sample: "PPPoE automatic restart settings are invalid, automatic restart will not be used"
Description: Automatic restart of PPPoE is disabled due to invalid settings.
Format: PPPoE automatic restart settings are invalid, automatic restart will not be used
Sample: PPPoE instance will restart automatically.
Sample: PPPoE instance will not restart automatically due to no link.
Description: Skipped PPPoE automatic restart because the link was not up
Format: Skipped PPPoE automatic restart because the link was not up
Sample: DHCPDISCOVER from 00:50:04:ce:c6:3d via eth1: network 192.168.111.0/24: no free leases
Description: Received DHCP discover from the client, but there are no free leases available.
Sample: The DHCP server offered an IP address to the specified client device.
Description: DHCPOFFER on 192.168.111.20 to 84:2b:2b:a6:02:3f (client) via eth1
Sample: Received DHCP request for specified IP address from the specified client.
Description: DHCPREQUEST for 192.168.111.20 from 84:2b:2b:a6:02:3f (client) via eth1
Sample: Specified type of scan completed
Sample: Specified type and stage of scan started
Description: On demand scan - stage 2 started
Name: On demand scan - stage 1 completed
Sample: On demand scan - stage 1 completed
Description: On demand scan - stage 1 completed
Format: On demand scan - stage 1 completed
Variables: On demand scan - stage 1 completed
Name: Cluster role failed over to backup
Sample: Cluster role failed over from master to backup
Description: Failed over from master to backup
Format: Failed over from master to backup
Name: Cluster role failed over to master
Sample: Cluster role failed over from backup to master
Description: Failed over from backup to master
Format: Failed over from backup to master
Sample: Invalid or missing feature key for dynamic routing protocol OSPF
Description: No valid feature key for the specified dynamic routing protocol.
Format: Invalid or missing feature key for dynamic routing protocol %s
Sample: Specifies the license status for a dynamic routing protocol.
Description: License for dynamic routing protocol BGP is valid
Format: License for dynamic routing protocol %s is %s
Variables: License for dynamic routing protocol ${proto} is ${status}
Sample: "Modem authentication failed, check your modem configuration"
Format: Modem authentication failed, check your modem configuration
Sample: Failed to add bridge tbr0 VLAN ID 1
Format: Failed to add bridge %s VLAN ID %d
Name: Failed to add interface IP address
Sample: Failed to add the specified IP address to the specified interface.
Sample: "[Cluster] Management interface setting is changed: interface from eth1 to eth2, IPv4 address from 10.0.1.3 to 10.0.2.3, IPv4 mask from 24 to 24, IPv6 CIDR from 2000::1/64 to 2001::2/64"
Description: The configuration for the cluster management interface changed. The log message specifies changes to the interface, IP address, mask and IPv6 address.
Format: [Cluster] Management interface setting is changed: interface from %s to %s, IPv4 address from %u.%u.%u.%u to %u.%u.%u.%u IPv4 mask from %d to %d IPv6 CIDR from %s to %s%s

Variables: "[Cluster] Management interface setting is changed: interface from ${pre_if} to ${new_if}, IPv4 address from ${pre_ip} to ${new_ip} IPv4 mask from ${pre_mask} to ${new_mask} IPv6 CIDR from ${pre_ipv6} to %{new_ipv6}%s"
Description: Deactivating the specified external interface.
Sample: Starting the scan for rogue wireless AP detection
Description: Starting rogue wireless AP detection scan.
Format: Starting the scan for rogue wireless AP detection
Name: Stop detecting rogue wireless AP
Sample: Stopping the scan for rogue wireless AP detection
Description: Stopping rogue wireless AP detection scan.
Format: Stopping the scan for rogue wireless AP detection
Name: Restart detecting rogue wireless AP
Sample: Restart the scan for rogue wireless AP detection
Description: Restart rogue wireless AP detection scan.
Format: Restart the scan for rogue wireless AP detection
Sample: An IPv6 interface was activated. The log message specifies the interface.
Name: PPPoE IP address change during cluster failover
Sample: "[eth0 (External)] PPPoE IP address changed during cluster failover, from 192.168.1.22 to 192.168.1.23"
Description: The cluster completed a failover. During the failover, the PPPoE IP address changed.
Format: [%s (%s)] PPPoE IP address changed during cluster failover, from %s to %s
Variables: "[${dev_name} (${if_name})] PPPoE IP address changes during cluster failover, from ${pre_ip} to ${new_ip}"
Name: No change for PPPoE IP address during cluster failover
Sample: [eth0 (External)] PPPoE IP address 192.168.1.22 did not change during cluster failover
Description: PPPoE IP address did not change during cluster failover.
Format: [%s (%s)] PPPoE IP address %u.%u.%u.%u did not change during cluster failover
Name: DHCP IP address change during cluster failover
Sample: "[eth0 (External)] DHCP IP address changed during cluster failover, from 192.168.1.22 to 192.168.1.23"
Description: The cluster completed a failover. During the failover, the DHCP IP address changed.
Format: [%s (%s)] DHCP IP address changed during cluster failover, from %s to %s
Variables: "[${dev_name} (${if_name})] DHCP IP address changes during cluster failover, from ${pre_ip} to ${new_ip}"
Name: No change for DHCP IP address during cluster failover
Sample: [eth0 (External)] DHCP IP address 192.168.1.22 did not change during cluster failover
Description: DHCP IP address did not change during cluster failover.
Format: [%s (%s)] DHCP IP address %u.%u.%u.%u did not change during cluster failover
Description: Shutting down the specified interface.
Sample: Interface is activated due to link-monitor success. The log message specifies the interface.
Description: [eth1 (Trusted)] Interface is activated due to link-monitor success.
Format: [%s (%s)] Interface is activated due to link-monitor success.
Sample: Interface is deactivated due to link-monitor failure. The log message specifies the interface.
Description: [eth1 (Trusted)] Interface is deactivated due to link-monitor failure.
Format: [%s (%s)] Interface is deactivated due to link-monitor failure.
Sample: Specified interface does not exist, The interface status is set to disabled.
Description: [eth1 (Trusted)] Interface is disabled because it does not exist
Format: [%s (%s)] Interface is disabled because it does not exist
Variables: [${dev_name} (${if_name})] Interface is disabled because it does not exist
Sample: The interface link status has changed. The log message specifies the new status.
Description: [eth1 (Trusted)] Interface link status changed to UP
Format: [%s (%s)] Interface link status changed to %s
Sample: Cluster is enabled and is forming.
Description: Cluster is enabled and is forming
Format: Cluster is enabled and is forming
Name: Cluster setting changed to disabled
Sample: The cluster setting was changed from enabled to disabled.
Description: Cluster setting changed from enabled to disabled
Format: Cluster setting changed from enabled to disabled
Sample: The role of this device in the active/passive (A/P) cluster changed. The log message specifies the old and new roles.
Description: [Cluster] Cluster A/P role successfully changed from master to idle.
Format: [Cluster] Cluster A/P role successfully changed from %s to %s.
Sample: The Cluster active/active (A/A) role changed. The log message specifies the old and new roles.
Description: [Cluster] Cluster A/A role successfully changed from master to idle.
Format: [Cluster] Cluster A/A role successfully changed from %s to %s.
Sample: IPv6 interface was deactivated. The log message specifies the interface.
Description: Shutting down specified IPv6 interface.
Sample: The Firebox or XTM device failed to authenticate for PPPoE.
Sample: PPPoE stopped unexpectedly due to an unknown error.
Sample: Replaced the assigned PPPoE IP address with the configured static IP address. The assigned IP address is retained as a secondary IP address for the interface.
Description: [eth2 (External)] Enforced PPPoE static IP address: 192.168.3.48 is replaced with 192.168.3.29
Format: [%s (%s)] Enforced PPPoE static IP address: %s is replaced with %s
Variables: [${dev_name} (${if_name})] Enforced PPPoE static IP address: ${nego_ip} is replaced with ${static_ip}
Sample: The specified interface established a PPPoE session. The log message also specifies the session ID, acquired IP address, and peer IP address.
Description: "[eth0 (External)] PPPoE session[11] is established, acquired IP address 192.168.3.48, peer 192.168.3.254"
Format: [%s (%s)] PPPoE session[%d] is established, acquired IP address %s, peer %s
Variables: "[${physical_name} (${ifname})] PPPoE session[${session_id}] is established, acquired IP address ${ipaddr}, peer ${peer_addr}"
Sample: The PPPoE session for the specified interface is disconnected.
Area: Networking / Rogue Access Point Detection
Sample: Scan started, it will last about 30 seconds, wireless traffic will be interrupted in the meantime
Area: Networking / Rogue Access Point Detection
Sample: Scan ended [Rogue AP Count] [Trusted AP Count]
Area: Networking / Rogue Access Point Detection
Sample: Scan detected Rogue AP, this AP is not in the list of 'Trusted Access Point Configuration'
Description: Scan=0-34 detected Rogue AP with mac_address='00:90:0b:1b:34:30'
Format: Scan=%u-%llu detected Rogue AP with %s
Area: Networking / Rogue Access Point Detection
Sample: Scan detected Trusted AP, this AP is in the list of 'Trusted Access Point Configuration'
Description: Scan=0-34 detected Trusted AP with mac_address='00:90:0b:1b:35:40'
Format: Scan=%u-%llu detected Trusted AP with %s
Sample: The Wireless Access Point appears to be a different model than what is configured in the Gateway Wireless Controller.
Description: "Model mismatch for configured Wireless Access Point [123456789ABCD]: configured as AP100, but appears to be AP200."
Format: Model mismatch for configured Wireless Access Point [%.13s]: configured as %s, but appears to be %s.
Variables: "Model mismatch for configured Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}]: configured as ${configured_model}, but appears to be ${actual_model}."
Name: Wireless Access Point activation failure
Sample: The Gateway Wireless Controller is unable to contact the WatchGuard LiveSecurity Service to activate the service and support contract for the Wireless Access Point.
Description: LiveSecurity Service activation failed for [20AP0275FF17A]; will try again later.
Format: LiveSecurity Service activation failed for [%.13s]; will try again later.
Variables: LiveSecurity Service activation failed for [${serial_no}]; will try again later.
Name: New Wireless Access Point discovered
Sample: A new Wireless Access Point has been discovered by the Gateway Wireless Controller.
Description: Discovered new Wireless Access Point model AP102 [123456789ABCD] at 10.0.42.15.
Format: Discovered new Wireless Access Point model %s [%.13s] at %s.
Variables: Discovered new Wireless Access Point model ${actual_model} [${serial_no}] at ${ip_address}.
Sample: Wireless Access Point [123456789ABCD] rebooted 92 seconds ago.
Description: A Wireless Access Point has rebooted.
Format: Wireless Access Point [%.13s] rebooted %lu seconds ago.
Variables: Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}] rebooted ${seconds} ago.
Name: Wireless Access Point went offline
Sample: Wireless Access Point 'South' [123456789ABCD] went offline.
Description: A Wireless Access Point has gone offline.
Format: Wireless Access Point '%s' [%.13s] went offline.
Variables: Wireless Access Point '${name}' [${serial_no}] went offline.
Name: Wireless Access Point now online
Sample: Wireless Access Point [123456789ABCD] now online.
Description: A Wireless Access Point is now online.
Format: Wireless Access Point [%.13s] now online.
Variables: Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}] is now online.
Name: Wireless Access Point firmware version change
Sample: Wireless Access Point [123456789ABCD] firmware version changed from 1.2.8.2 to 1.2.9.1.
Description: The Wireless Access Point firmware version has changed.
Format: Wireless Access Point [%.13s] firmware version changed from %s to %s.
Variables: Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}] firmware version changed from ${old_firmware_ver} to ${current_firmware_ver}.
Name: Wireless Access Point configuration updated
Sample: Configuration updated on Wireless Access Point [123456789ABCD].
Description: The Wireless Access Point has been reconfigured.
Format: Configuration updated on Wireless Access Point [%.13s].
Variables: Configuration updated on Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}].
Sample: This log is generated whenever an unpaired Wireless Access Point is automatically deployed due to the Automatic Deployment setting being enabled.
Description: Automatically deploying Wireless Access Point [ABC1234567890].
Format: Automatically deploying Wireless Access Point [%.13s].
Variables: Automatically deploying Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}].
Name: Wireless Access Point Trust Failure
Sample: This log is generated whenever a deployed Wireless Access Point fails its trust validation check (digital certificate or host key failure).
Description: Wireless Access Point 'Break Room' [ABC1234567890] has failed trust validation for 192.168.1.2.
Format: Wireless Access Point '%s' [%.13s] has failed trust validation for %s.
Variables: Wireless Access Point '${name}' [${serial_no}] has failed trust validation for ${ip_address}.
Name: Wireless Access Point Trust Validation Restored
Sample: This log is generated whenever a deployed Wireless Access Point successfully restores its trust validation check (digital certificate or host key validation).
Description: Wireless Access Point 'Lobby' [ABC1234567890] restored its trust validation for 192.168.1.2.
Format: Wireless Access Point '%s' [%.13s] restored its trust validation for %s.
Variables: Wireless Access Point '${name}' [${serial_no}] restored its trust validation for ${ip_address}.
Sample: The Wireless Access Point has been paired with the Gateway Wireless Controller.
Description: Wireless Access Point [123456789ABCD] has been paired.
Format: Wireless Access Point [%.13s] has been paired.
Variables: Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}] has been paired.
Sample: The Wireless Access Point has been unpaired with the Gateway Wireless Controller, and will be reset to the factory default configuration.
Description: Wireless Access Point [123456789ABCD] has been unpaired.
Format: Wireless Access Point [%.13s] has been unpaired.
Variables: Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}] has been unpaired.
Sample: The Gateway Wireless Controller has detected a Rogue Access Point at the given BSSID, broadcasting the indicated SSID.
Description: "Rogue Access Point detected at 00:90:7f:00:00:00, broadcasting SSID 'MyCorp Pub"."
Format: Rogue Access Point detected at %02hhx:%02hhx:%02hhx:%02hhx:%02hhx:%02hhx, broadcasting SSID %s.
Variables: "Rogue Access Point detected at ${bssid}, broadcasting SSID "${ssid}"."
Sample: If scheduled restarts are enabled, this log message will appear prior to the restart action taking place on the specified Wireless Access Point.
Description: Initating scheduled automatic wireless reboot on Wireless Access Point [ABC1234567890].
Format: Initiating scheduled automatic reboot on Wireless Access Point [%.13s].
Variables: Initiating scheduled automatic reboot on Wireless Access Point [${serial_no}].
